cons: Not really to speak of, great as an undergrad researcher
As a student worker, I support the manager. No cons so far.

pros: Genuinely nice people to work with; true to their beliefs. Chapel on-site during the day if you want it!
cons: low pay and not much opportunity for advancement

review_title: Good place to work for if you value education and your work meaning something.
pros:
Great Vacation and holidays.
Good tuition benefits.
cons:
Low wages
Poor health care options.

review_title: Pockets of AMAZING colleagues - but challenging administrative structures
pros: Here and there are pockets of AMAZING colleagues - folks who understand our student body, work hard for access and support for students, and support diversity/inclusion efforts. Students are by and large really great too. If you are lucky enough to work with good colleagues, you should really enjoy working here. My own supervisor is flexible with time off, which is great if you have family commitments at odd times - but that may vary across campus.
cons: Unfortunately, there is an overall culture that is passive agressive/conflict avoiding. This leads to pockets of poor work and no accountability. HR also does not have clear performance review practices, and those they have are not followed uniformly across campus. If your personal supervisor cares/has the resources to support your professional growth/development, great. If not, you are stuck. I think pay is moderate or on the low end.

pros: Progressive culture of teaching and learning

Amazing students, terrific colleagues, competitive pay, great benefits.  Mission driven.  The commitment to diversity and service to the community are really valued at Augsburg.  Many places have diversity in their mission, but Augsburg actually lives it each day.  And the focus is really on the students - helping them come here, stay here, and be successful.
cons: Not a lot of management layers, which can limit ability to get promoted.  Also, some faculty and staff are ingrained in doing things the same way just because they have always done it that way.  Change can take a long time.

pros: Union protects you from being fired, without just cause.
cons: Union with equal opportunity employment, produced the worst employee output I have ever encountered.

pros: The hours are flexible, the work culture is friendly and helpful. It is a laid back atmosphere with a great team that is always willing to help. The staff are understanding and fun. They are serious about their work and appreciate a balanced life style and value the importance of education.
cons: The work is sporadic and repetitive. There are patrons who are demanding and the work can be thankless at times. Sometimes there is not enough hours and the pay is not very high.

review_title: residence life as a learning experience
pros: This opportunity was very educational as a student at the time. The work is quite simple and a housing stipend is available
cons: There are downsides to any employer. The only downside found here was that most of the meetings were unnecessary. The department spent money that could have been used in other areas more effectively.

review_title: Awesome student employer, learned a lot
job_title: Classroom Services Technician in Minneapolis, MN
pros:
-Very easy to balance work and school,
-Lots to learn here letting you grow as a student as an IT worker. 
-Lots of downtime that can be used for homework or other things.
cons:
Not a lot of opportunity for advancement, Sometimes work can get boring. 
Hourly wage is low for the work we are doing, though it is a student job.

review_title: Great place for a summer job
pros: URGO program was a blast and I got to research something I am passionate about. Going to help a lot for graduate school.
cons: I wish I had more than 10 weeks to work on the research with. However going ahead I would like to publish the work but would need more work done first.

review_title: Great experience in Space Physics research
job_title: Student Space Physics Research in Minneapolis, MN
pros: I learned a lot working in the Space Physics research. I learned a lot about the equipment used and gained experience in IDL programming language.
cons: Sometimes, data would be obscured due to equipment or server malfunctions.

pros: Fair amount of autonomy in the classroom
cons: Low salary, little support for an instructor that comes in sporadically.

pros: I appreciated the community of colleagues that I worked with. They were committed, kind, and respectful.
cons: We struggled with enrollment at the time, so staffing consistency was challenging.

pros: Great people to work with and employees children get to go to college for 100 percent free.
Flexible work environment, great vacation, sick, 403b
cons: HR leadership is poor-  doesn't trust or support staff
